brief_summary.textblock:
To investigate the prognosis due to presence or absence of bile duct resection in
      intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma that require hepatic lobectomy.

clinical_study.brief_title: Role of Bile Duct Resection in Major Hepatectomy Due to Intrahepatic Cholangiocarcinoma

detailed_description.textblock:
The bile duct resection in hepatic lobectomy due to cholangiocarcinoma, mass forming type,
      is still controversial.  We retrospectively evaluated the effect of bile duct resection in
      this surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Cases of major hepatectomy due to intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma

        Exclusion Criteria:

        -

study_pop.textblock:
All patients who underwent hepatic lobectomy between 2000 and 2010 for intrahepatic
        cholangiocarcinoma, and did not undergo adjuvant chemotherapy will be included for
        analysis.

facility.name: Osaka University, Graduate School of Medicine

clinical_study.official_title: Role of Bile Duct Resection in Major Hepatectomy Due to Intrahepatic Cholangiocarcinoma

overall_official.affiliation: Osaka University, Graduate School of Medicine

primary_outcome.measure: Ratio of local recurrence at the hepatico-duodenal ligament

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Retrospective
